result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas not guilty.  Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:38 pm.

Defendant's Notice of Hearing (8/1/22). Return to Sender. Moved Left No address.

1:03 AM Leopold Martinez appears via zoom, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews DE's rights on waiver of personal appearance. Sgt. Logan Dohmeier. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Sgt. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings. Court will schedule ARGN. Court adjourned at 1:26 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
No contact with MDM, RSK or their residence.
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Absolute sobriety.
Def from PCJ

03:51 PM Defendant Leopold Martinez in court, in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court.   Defendant has copy of complaint(s) and has read them. Court verifies Defendant's address and DOB.   Court reads charges and possible penalties. Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Court waives. Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant to contact PD for eligibility.  ADA Schieffer: $1,000 cash bond; no contact with MDM, RSK or their residence, absolute sobriety, no possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Gives argument for cash bond. Atty Nelson: inability to pay cash bond. Court takes notice of extradition case. Court orders cash bond with conditions as requested. 4:03  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
